com.rockhoppertech.music

Class PitchFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rockhoppertech.music.PitchFactory

  • public final class PitchFactory
extends Object

    Uses the GoF flyweight pattern. Consider using this first to obtain Pitch instances rather than creating them yourself.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Gene De Lisa

    • Field Summary

      • EQUAL_TEMPERAMENT

        public static final Map<Integer,Double> EQUAL_TEMPERAMENT

        You can get a frequency based on midi number.

        For use in the Gof flyweight design pattern.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static PitchFactory getInstance()
        Singleton pattern. But, since all methods are static, this is not really needed.
        Returns:
        a PitchFactory instance

      • getPitch

        public static Pitch getPitch(double midiNumber)
        Parameters:
        midiNumber - the MIDI pitch value 0-127.
        Returns:
        a cached Pitch instance

      • getPitch

        public static Pitch getPitch(int midiNumber)

        Retrieves a cached instance. If it doesn't yet exist in the cache it is created and cached.

        Parameters:
        midiNumber - a MIDI pitch number 0-127.
        Returns:
        the matching Pitch

      • getPitchByName

        public static Pitch getPitchByName(String name)

      • getPitch

        public static Pitch getPitch(String pitchString)

        Retrieves a cached instance. If it doesn't yet exist in the cache it is created and cached.

        Parameters:
        pitchString - name plus octave number e.g. C5
        Returns:
        the matching Pitch

      • createFromFrequency

        public static Pitch createFromFrequency(double freq)
        Parameters:
        freq - the frequence in hz
        Returns:
        a Pitch with midiNumber and cents set
